sn11.23:4.3: “Once upon a time, mendicants, Vepacitti, Lord of Demons, was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
sn11.23:4.4: Then Sakka went to see him to ask after his illness.
sn11.23:4.5: Vepacitti saw Sakka coming off in the distance,
sn11.23:4.9: ‘I can’t do that, good sir, until I have consulted with the demons.’
sn11.23:4.10: Then Vepacitti, lord of demons, asked the demons:
sn11.23:4.11: ‘Good sirs, may I teach the Sambari sorcery to Sakka, lord of gods?’
sn11.23:4.12: ‘Do not, good sir, teach the Sambari sorcery to Sakka!’
sn11.23:4.13: So Vepacitti addressed Sakka in verse:
sn11.23:5.3: a sorceror falls into the terrible hell—
sn11.23:5.4: like Sambara, for a hundred years.’”
